description: Docs: Author PRD for scheduled tasks (endpoint-based)
Docs: Add scratchpad decisions/constraints for scheduled tasks
Docs: Document schedule execution contract (synthetic HTTP payload)
Docs: Document remap-on-update policy and override UX
Docs: Add operator notes for cleanup/no-cascades constraints
DB: Create table `extension_api_endpoint` with unique (version_id, method, path)
DB: Create table `tenant_extension_schedule` keyed by install_id + endpoint_id
DB: Add indexes for tenant/install lookups on schedules
DB: Add nullable fields for last_run_at/status/error on schedules
DB: Add fields to store external schedule handle id (Temporal schedule id / pgboss schedule name)
DB: Add optional payload_json to schedule definition
DB: Add soft-delete support (deleted_at) for schedules (optional)
DB: Add schedule_id to extension execution logs for correlation (new column or separate table)
DB: Add audit log records for schedule CRUD actions
DB: Add constraints/guards for max schedule name length and cron/timezone string lengths
Registry: Normalize and persist manifest endpoints into `extension_api_endpoint` when creating a version
Registry: Ensure endpoint normalization (method uppercasing, path begins with /)
Registry: De-duplicate endpoints by (method,path) during ingest
Registry: Backfill endpoints for existing versions (one-time job or lazy materialization)
Registry: Provide query to list endpoints for a version_id
Registry: Provide query to list endpoints for an install (resolve version_id -> endpoints)
Registry: Standardize endpoint source of truth (avoid divergence between api vs api_endpoints)
API: Add endpoint listing API for extension settings dropdown (tenant-scoped)
API: Validate that returned endpoints match the currently installed version for the tenant
API: Add pagination/search for endpoints list (optional)
Schedule API: List schedules for an extension install
Schedule API: Create schedule (endpoint_id + cron + timezone + enabled)
Schedule API: Update schedule fields (cron/timezone/enabled/name/payload/endpoint)
Schedule API: Delete schedule and underlying job-runner schedule (no cascades)
Schedule API: Run-now endpoint to trigger immediate execution
Schedule API: Input validation for cron string and timezone
Schedule API: Input validation that endpoint_id belongs to the install’s version_id
Schedule API: Enforce max schedules per install
Schedule API: Enforce minimum frequency / deny too-frequent cron expressions
Schedule API: Enforce rate limit for run-now calls
Schedule API: Return structured errors suitable for UI display (field-level)
Schedule API: Authorization checks aligned with extension settings access
Server actions: Add getExtensionEndpoints action for UI (if not using route directly)
Server actions: Add getExtensionSchedules action for settings UI
Server actions: Add create/update/delete schedule actions
Server actions: Add run-now action
Jobs: Define schedule job type for 'scheduled extension invocation'
Jobs: Register schedule job handler in job handler registry
Jobs: Use IJobRunner.scheduleRecurringJob to create durable schedule (Temporal schedule in EE)
Jobs: Choose stable singleton key naming for schedules (install_id + schedule_id)
Jobs: Persist external schedule handle id on schedule record
Jobs: Support enable/disable by pausing/deleting underlying schedule and recreating as needed
Jobs: Implement run-now as immediate job trigger separate from recurring schedule
Runner invoke: Implement internal helper to call Runner /v1/execute with synthetic http payload
Runner invoke: Load install config by install_id (providers, secrets, config, content hash)
Runner invoke: Build context that includes schedule_id + trigger type + invocation id
Runner invoke: Serialize payload_json into request body_b64 (JSON)
Runner invoke: Apply same header filtering rules as gateway (or define schedule-specific allowlist)
Runner invoke: Enforce timeout and size limits for scheduled invocations
Runner invoke: Capture response status/body for logs and schedule last_run fields
Execution control: Default 'no overlap' per schedule (lock/lease)
Execution control: Add idempotency key per run-now invocation
Execution control: Retry policy for schedule runs (job runner retries + recorded attempts)
Execution control: Decide catch-up semantics after downtime (skip/backfill/run-once)
Remap: Implement remap procedure on extension install update by matching (method,path)
Remap: Block extension version update if any schedule cannot be remapped
Remap: Return structured error containing schedule ids and missing endpoints
Remap: Add override action to disable affected schedules and proceed with update
Remap: Record remap actions in audit log
Remap: Ensure remap is transactional with the install update (all-or-nothing)
Cleanup: On extension uninstall, delete all schedules and underlying runner schedules
Cleanup: On install disable, disable schedules (policy: keep config, stop execution)
Cleanup: On tenant delete, ensure schedules are cleaned up via admin tooling/jobs
Cleanup: On schedule delete, delete Temporal schedule/pgboss schedule and clear external id
Cleanup: Add reconciliation job to detect orphan schedules and clean them
Security: Enforce permissions for schedule CRUD and run-now (tenant admin only)
Security: Enforce that only endpoints from installed version are selectable
Security: Validate path parameter endpoints are disallowed or require static substitution
Security: Apply per-tenant caps for number of schedules and invocation rate
Security: Store only non-sensitive schedule fields; encourage using install secrets for credentials
Observability: Write execution logs for schedule runs with schedule_id correlation
Observability: Update schedule last_run_at/status/error after each run
Observability: Emit metrics (runs, failures, duration) for scheduled invocations
Observability: Add UI surface for recent run history (optional v1)
Observability: Add audit events for schedule CRUD and run-now
UI: Add 'Schedules' section to ExtensionSettings screen
UI: List schedules with endpoint, cron, timezone, enabled, last run
UI: Add schedule creation UI with endpoint dropdown
UI: Add schedule edit UI
UI: Add enable/disable toggle and confirm flows
UI: Add delete schedule confirm flow
UI: Add run-now action and toast feedback
UI: Cron validation feedback and help text
UI: Timezone selector with tenant default fallback
UI: Optional JSON payload editor with validation
UI: Display endpoint invalidation after upgrade (schedule marked invalid)
UI: Display upgrade-blocking error with affected schedules and remediation actions
API: Add install update endpoint that triggers remap and can be blocked
API: Add 'disable affected schedules and proceed' endpoint (override)
Validation: Add cron parser/validator in backend (shared util)
Validation: Add timezone validator against IANA tz database
Validation: Ensure schedule payload_json size limit
Validation: Ensure schedule names are unique per install (optional)
Performance: Ensure schedule list queries are indexed and tenant-scoped
Performance: Avoid N+1 queries when loading endpoints and schedules for settings UI
Compat: Ensure CE behavior is safe (either disable schedules or use PgBossJobRunner when available)
Compat: Feature flag scheduled tasks UI for staged rollout
Ops: Add admin tool to list schedules per tenant/extension for support
Ops: Add admin tool to manually disable all schedules for a tenant (kill switch)
Ops: Add admin tool to backfill endpoints for a version id
Data integrity: Prevent deleting an endpoint row that is referenced by an active schedule (enforced in service)
Data integrity: Ensure schedule create uses a transaction to persist schedule + create durable runner schedule
Data integrity: Ensure schedule update is transactional with rescheduling operations
Data integrity: Ensure schedule delete is transactional with runner schedule deletion
Execution: Enforce that scheduled invocations set x-alga-tenant/x-alga-extension context consistently
Execution: Ensure scheduled invocations do not include a user context (or use a system user identity)
Execution: Add schedule-specific request_id generation and correlation ids
UX: Add copyable curl-like debug view of schedule invocation request (optional)
UX: Show next-run time (best-effort) using cron parsing and timezone
UX: Inline warning when endpoint contains path params (disallow or require input)
Rollback: Ensure schedule execution is paused when extension install is disabled
Rollback: Ensure schedule execution uses the currently installed content_hash (not cached stale)
Testing: Add unit tests for endpoint materialization normalization
Testing: Add unit tests for remap logic
Testing: Add integration tests for schedule CRUD APIs
Testing: Add integration tests for run-now invocation hitting Runner stub
Testing: Add E2E tests for ExtensionSettings schedule UI
Migration: Add data migration/backfill script to populate extension_api_endpoint from existing extension_version.api_endpoints
Migration: Add safe idempotent backfill behavior for repeated runs
Policy: Define schedule concurrency policy (forbid overlap) and implement locking
Policy: Define retry/backoff defaults for schedule runs and expose in UI (optional)
Policy: Define schedule pause behavior on repeated failures (optional)
API: Add endpoint to validate cron/timezone before saving (optional)
API: Add endpoint to preview next N run times for a schedule (optional)
Support: Add schedule export/import for tenant migrations (optional)
Hardening: Ensure schedule create/update/delete are safe under concurrent requests (optimistic locking)
Hardening: Add per-schedule revision/version field to prevent lost updates
Hardening: Ensure schedule execution fails gracefully when install config cannot be loaded
Hardening: Ensure schedule execution handles Runner timeouts cleanly and records status
Hardening: Ensure schedule deletion handles missing runner schedule handle (idempotent)
UI: Add empty state for schedules when none exist
UI: Add loading states and error states for schedules list
UI: Add permissions-gated UI (hide schedules if user lacks rights)
Docs: Add developer documentation for scheduling endpoint invocation semantics
Docs: Add operator documentation for remap failures and override flow
Telemetry: Tag schedule runs with schedule_id in logs and metrics consistently
Telemetry: Add per-schedule failure count and last_success_at fields (optional)
Compliance: Ensure schedule CRUD actions are auditable and retained
API: Add endpoint to fetch a single schedule by id
API: Add endpoint to bulk-disable schedules for an install
Remap: Provide preview endpoint to show remap results before applying update
Remap: Ensure schedules that were disabled remain disabled after remap
Scheduler: Add periodic health check that underlying Temporal schedules exist for enabled DB schedules
Scheduler: Auto-repair missing schedule handles (optional)
Gateway parity: Reuse gateway header/body size limits for scheduled invocations
Gateway parity: Reuse gateway timeout config for scheduled invocations (EXT_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT_MS)
UX: Show which version the endpoint selection is based on (installed version)
UX: Show warning when changing endpoint selection will affect schedule semantics
Infra: Ensure Temporal schedule IDs are globally unique and deterministic
Infra: Ensure CE/pgboss schedule naming avoids collisions per tenant
API: Add admin-only endpoint to list schedules across tenants (support)
API: Add admin-only endpoint to delete a schedule by id (support)

Docs: Add troubleshooting guide for schedule executions (common errors)
Definition: Decide whether schedules can target only GET/POST or all methods
Definition: Decide whether schedules can include query params (v1 likely no)
Definition: Decide whether schedules can target endpoints with path params (v1 likely no)

Hardening: Ensure schedule execution checks install is enabled before invoking
Hardening: Ensure uninstall path cleans schedules before deleting tenant_extension_install row
